subject: Economics
subcategory: Economic Crises That Shook the World
title: Bank Runs: When Trust Leaves the Building
description: Learn Bank Runs: When Trust Leaves the Building in one minute.

hook.text: Between 1930 and 1933, 9,000 American banks failed. One in three.

buildup.text: A bank run starts when a few people withdraw cash. Others see the line and panic.

twist.text: FDR created FDIC deposit insurance in 1933. Bank runs virtually stopped overnight.

climax.text: Deposit insurance costs the government almost nothing.

punchline.text: The cheapest insurance in history is the one that's never claimed.

quiz.question: Why did FDIC deposit insurance virtually eliminate bank runs?
options: Guaranteed deposits removed the incentive to panic-withdraw, preventing self-fulfilling crises
